title: Comment with a champion, and see if someone will respond with how to deal with them!
body:
Lately there's been another rise in people complaining about champions (something normal to the boards). And so, thought it'd be a great idea to make at thread where people can ask how to play around a certain champion and get an answer! When you comment, also say what lane/situation you need help dealing with them in (such as Yasuo mid in lane, or Darius in teamfights)

Edit: please remember to upvote the thread so this can be visible to more people if you want to get answer!

replies.body:
Just for shits and giggles I'll post my main and see what people come up with

{{champion:30}}
Play soraka

Just dodge his Qs. Wait for Karthus to lose mana and then push turret. Karthus's kit is about dealing poke damage over time, not burst damage. Wait for him to exhaust his mana and he becomes extremely weak.


Edit:
What I meant is that Karthus can't burst you unless he catches you alone. Don't try and solo him away from minions unless you have MR, or can easily outdamage him.

I love that your suggestion for defeating a champ is:

"Wait for the player playing him to fuck up a lot, then punish them for being bad."

A good Karth will only try to poke at an opponet with spare mana, and only go in on them when they overextend and he can wall of pain them and kite/Q spam them.

Only an idiot slams Qs all over the place in hopes they land some and then goes oom.
I mean, capitalizing off of misplays is pretty much what you're supposed to do against anyone.

Yes, youre correct.

But in a thread about "how to deal with" and then a specific champ... what youre supposed to do against anyone is in poor taste imo.
------------------------------------

Some ways to actually deal with Karth would probably include playing champs with lots of mobility. Champs with CC immunity or cleanse effects like Eve or GP. If you get caught by his wall of pain, then you will infact be in pain cause thats at least 2 Qs you will probably eat.

So any champ going up against him mid lane would have a much better laning phase if they bought {{item:3111}} . Even if youre AP you can sell them later. They will significantly aid in avoiding his Qs, help take fewer Qs when you get hit with wall of pain, and help offset the magipen from the wall. Another option is {{item:3009}} for avoiding Qs and recovering from wall of pain.

Champs like Yasuo, Zed, and Kat have the mobility to avoid repeated Qs and Zed and Kat can bypass the wall potentially if they get caught on the wrong side or want to continue an assault. AD champs can of course build {{item:3814}} for timed ult avoidance. Anyone can build a {{item:3102}} and have a decent chance of ignoring a few ults.

The most important thing is to never focus down a Karth first at an objective like Baron or Dragon because he will still be there as a ghost from his passive using attacks in the area. If you kill him in a general teamfight, leave the area. He will still be there and be vengeful.

Probably the best tip I can give is to really keep track of the jungler on Karths team. I know I slam my ult when the jungler is ganking bot every time I can. If I KNOW it will kill my enemy mid laner I will possibly do it, but sometimes I resist the urge and wait on that botlane gank. It gives me a good shot at either 2 assist, a kill and an assist, or a double kill.

Also if youre keeping wards up, it should be easier to avoid Karth ganks because if he comes to your lane with wall of pain then life is about to suck.

As was mentioned Soraka can really help take the sting out of a Karth ult, and avoid him getting a post teamfight/gank triple kill from anywhere on the map. Champs like Kayle and Lee Sin on your team also can aid in spot saving people from death.

If Karth gets ahead then avoiding him and trying to take objectives he isnt near till you can catch up is helpful. If hes really ahead then MR and playing smart are the only choices because if he ever gets to a point where he can ult and the lowest damage he does to anyone is 500 then other people may be taking 650 or even 800. At 500 AP and lvl 3 ult his base damage on ult is 850. With enough magipen he can ult and cut the HP on some of the enemy team by 1/2 to 1/3. It may also hit the enemy team with {{item:3116}} .

If people play smart, dont feed Karth then he can be burned down quickly. Leaving the immediate area and resetting the engage will still have him doing some damage to your team, but hopefuly avoid any deaths.

Lastly {{item:3026}} can help deal with him if isnt very strong but definitely a threat. Its another way to negate his ult as a killing tool. Its also a way to avoid giving him gold if he manages to take you down with his death passive.

You should always try to capatilize off misplays, but "hope your opponent is terrible" is not good advice for how to play against a champion. And a Karthus has to be beyond bad to actually run themselves oom with Q spam.

Kassadin probably plays the farm game just as well and ends up oneshotting Karthus later + the presence of Hexdrinker/Edge of Night/Abyssal Scepter/Mercurial Scimitar means he has a bad time trying to even get damage off late game
idk man. late game karthus is still late game karthus. he does a shit ton of damage later in the game.

{{champion:80}} top lane

I enjoy losing farm hugging tower and getting poked by Q until lee eventually dives me.

Believe it or not, he has an incredible mana drop, keep an eye on his mana, cause his full combo cost 145 mana(only E scales with level, Q is 45 and W is 55 respectively.) 

If he cant use his full combo, go ham. To make him waste mana on you(and if he spears a minion, thats a victory) get some form of sustain and tankiness, if you go 0-0 in lane thats a massive win, cause he falls off damn hard.

His passive makes him nigh impossible to trade with cause autos are a big part of your damage in fights, and a good Pantheon will try to always keep his up, often getting 2-3 per fight(W refreshes it! 4 aa/spells put it back up, meaning even if you just proced it, a full spell rotation and an AA puts it back up.) 

Keep in mind if he uses his W to engage he loses out on procing his passive, meaning he will take more damage, try to fight him a bit and dont let him just WAAQE and run away, Darius works pretty well but don't use W on him when he has passive, it gets negated.

Possible counter picks: Renekton, Fiora(Easy W), Riven, Rumble. People with shields to block poke and still have the damages.
If you have more specific match-up questions, ask away.
Riven doesn't counter pantheon, his aegis blocks auto attacks and autos are 70% of rivens damage, especially early game since her q does negligible damage and your w does less then an auto.

I was just thinking along the line of manaless and has a shield, which effectively makes laning against him so much more manageable.

I really didn't think about all in, and most Riven main to some extent can W Panth's W with a good set up and good reactions, effectively cancelling eachothers stuns out even if Rivens is 0.25 seconds less. NOT TO MENTION most Riven mains know that just facing a target then pressing Q behind them still does the Q, but she doesn't stop right in front, effectively making it more "sticky" while potentially getting behind them, making Panth's E half as effective.

I don't want new Riven's to lane into Panth, because most of them are to focused to actually examine the match up all that deeply while most Panths will just be focusing on trading autos and throwing Q's till they can all in.

EDIT: It's about who is the aggressor in the trade, Panth loses out on his passive using W to engage, while Riven loses out on a shield or damage, however in the passive play style, which is the last thing on Riven players minds(gotta get that first blood!) she actually wins, cause Pantheon falls off, she can deal with poke, and such, so Yeah I still think Riven is a counter because both are such snowball champions, but Riven only gets better while Pantheon only falls harder in an even lane.

Someone tanky early or with high sustain (Renekton, Darius, Nautilus, Maokai) can survive well against him, and surviving early is about all you can hope to do. As long as he doesn't snowball then you win, because Pantheon falls off like a cliff.

Also, invest in early items such as Corrupting potion, Doran's shield, and early armor.

Alright, so the way to beat Pantheon is coordination.  Especially with your jungler.  Pantheon is such a lane bully that if you're not playing specific anti-Pantheon champions (basically high armor tanks or characters with better range harass than him, such as Quinn) your best bet is to just farm, and talk to your jungler and team.  The worst thing to happen to me as a Panth main is a jungler camping my lane.  

But here's the thing, so long as you keep him from killing you and stay roughly even with your cs you win.  A Pantheon that doesn't have 3+ kills by the time mid-game starts is a Pantheon who is going to be having a very bad day.

Now, because of his ult, if you're playing too passively for him, he may jump to other lanes.

This again, is countered by you talking to your team.  You MUST tell them that Panth has his ult up.  You MUST tell them when he hits 6.  Your job is to make him waste his ult jumping on someone who safely gets out of the way making him whiff his ult and about half his mana in the early game.  And allows you time to keep farming your lane.  

Keep coordinating, keep talking, and stay safe.  Organize ganks with your jungler.  If he's a usual Panth player he will start taking greater and greater risks to get kills which you can try to capitalize on.  If he's smart and just tries to farm, hopefully you have gotten to the point where you can at least survive his burst and get out and back to heal and keep farming.

After that, you've won.  Pantheon falls off incredibly hard.  If you make him money starved during the mid-game, his usual time to try and finish up a game or set up his allies to victory then you're basically now playing a 4v5.

Sadly, all of this depends on your allies willingness to listen to you.  Try to be polite, when giving your warnings and asking for help.  Try to let him push so he looks like a tempting target for your jungler.  And understand if there's something a bit more important than you currently in play (say a dragon fight) you're on your own.  Your job is just to survive.  It may not be fun.  It may be a pain in the ass, but know you're making that douchebag playing Pantheon on the other end not having fun either.  He knows his limitations, he knows if he's not killing you he's going to be useless in about 15-20 minutes.

This type of response is cancer.

Did I say "just cc her" though? I said force her into teamfights then use CC in order to burst her, because she is inherently squishy and is easy to CC.
Except for the part where her W makes her immune to CC lol

In team fights, any decent team comp is bound to have multiple sources of CC, and being team fights are hectic as is, I have no doubt she can't block everything, and being more of a DPS unit, making her use her W is a victory in that she's not DPSing and now more vulnerable.

If you force CC onto her and she blocks any of it. That's CC you didnt use to peel for your own ADC or to lock down theirs. Essentially meaning you wasted it and is always a victory for the Fiora player. "just CC her" doesn't work for Fiora because it is a win-win for her

It still means she has to spend the second it takes to cast not doing anything else. It's still just like cc.

And you can still burst her afterwards.

No, it is not. Normal CC you can follow up with Damage. This you can't. 

We havent even mentioned the part where if you do try and hard CC her she just makes you fuck your entire team by using that CC on you

Then there is no straight answer, your basically saying the same thing as forcing someone to sidestep an Elise cocoon, the don't do anything while dodging, and your are not doing any CC cause you missed.
It isnt the same, you can dodge something and still cast abilities. She can literally reverse punish you for trying to CC her and is immune to all damage while she does it

It takes an entire skill slot, and fits her theme. Honestly it's like Irelia's E, she can punish for winning a trade, the same is for Fiora, it's single target and honestly doesn't mean much in teamfights besides a miniature zhonyas and possibly stunning someone. You make her sound un-killable in teamfights, the fact is anyone can die in teamfights, regardless of a 1 second counter stance.

So, Why do you insist that she has no counter? I can think of infinite examples of counter comps while you could think of a million counter examples. No one is immune to CC forever(Fuck you too Olaf, 6 seconds is not forever.) and CC counters everyone in a sense, the inability to so something.
Perhaps TheJakeinator's persistence with his point is due to a personal bias. It's the only explanation I can think of as to why he refuses to recognize the opposition's valid points.
